pullRequest.title: SQL TRIM function
pullRequest.bodyText:
This PR adds a family of TRIM functions to the SQL engine.
The generic syntax of the command is TRIM(LEADING/TRAILING/BOTH [chars] FROM input). Alternative syntaxes:

TRIM(TRAILING/LEADING/BOTH input) == TRIM(LEADING/TRAILING/BOTH ' ' FROM input)
TRIM(input) == TRIM(BOTH ' ' FROM input)

We also add several shortcut functions:

LTRIM(input) == TRIM(LEADING ' ' FROM input)
RTRIM(input) == TRIM(TRAILING ' ' FROM input)
BTRIM(input) == TRIM(input) == TRIM(BOTH ' ' FROM input)

The function is supported by Calcite parser. and has a built-in Calcite operator. However, the operator lacks support for dynamic parameters. Therefore, we redefine the function in our operator table, copy-pasting several methods from the original Calcite's SqlTrimFunction class. LTRIM/RTRIM/BTRIM are defined as separate functions, but converge to a single TrimFunction expression during expression conversion.
LEADING/TRAILING/BOTH keywords are interpreted as literals of SYMBOL type, which was not supported before. This PR adds support for SYMBOL literals.

commit.message: Removed unnecessary tests for Float.MIN_VALUE and Double.MIN_VALUE
Added missing test for numeric literals in single quotes for CEIL/FLOOR tests
Test for several rows for RAND
Fixed inference for double functions (DECIMAL -> DOUBLE) and RAND (DECIMAL -> BIGINT)
Changed operand type inference for double functions
DoubleFunction: removed concrete functions from JavaDoc.
Added lenght overflow handling to ROUND/TRUNCATE

nodes.bodyText: We miss the test for TRIM(' ' FROM null) case
Wouldn't it be easier to use ArrayList to build the constructor list and then use toArray on it and avoid this LEN constant? Seems like micro-optimization.

commit.message: Added test for TRIM(' ' FROM null)

nodes.bodyText: None of the methods are used in this PR except asVarchar.
